paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses BRCA2 variants S206C and T207A, their effects on phosphorylation by PLK1, and their implications in breast cancer.

functional_data.summary: The S206C variant impairs phosphorylation of BRCA2 by PLK1, affecting its function in mitosis.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with reduced binding to PLK1.
key_quotes: Interestingly, variants T207A and S206C also led to a 2-fold decrease in PLK1 phosphorylation of BRCA21–250.

functional_data.summary: The T207A variant significantly reduces the phosphorylation of BRCA2 by PLK1, leading to impaired function.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with reduced binding to PLK1.
key_quotes: The reduction of BRCA2 phosphorylation in BRCA21-250 containing T207A and S206C variants suggested that these residues could be targets for PLK1 phosphorylation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
